BRONCHOSCOPY NOTE
Date: [REDACTED]
Patient: [REDACTED] | MRN: [REDACTED] | Age: 74F
Attending: Dr. James Wilson, MD
Location: [REDACTED]

INDICATION: 74F on mechanical ventilation for respiratory failure. New RLL collapse on CXR. Suspected mucus plugging.

PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy with therapeutic aspiration

ANESTHESIA: Already sedated/paralyzed on ventilator

FINDINGS:
- ETT: 7.5mm at 22cm, no granulation
- Trachea: Copious thick yellow secretions
- RMS: Thick mucus plug at RMS/BI junction
- RLL: Complete mucus impaction with cast
- Left lung: Moderate secretions

PROCEDURE: Extensive suctioning performed. Large mucus cast removed from RLL basal segments using suction and saline lavage. Post-procedure, all segments patent.

SPECIMENS: Secretions sent for culture

POST-PROCEDURE: CXR showed re-expansion of RLL. Ventilator weaning resumed.

Dr. James Wilson, MD
